thread.section_title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho admits managing Brazil would be ‘very exciting’ – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho admits managing Brazil would be ‘very exciting’
thread.title_full: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho admits managing Brazil would be ‘very exciting’

author: Tom Olver
title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho admits managing Brazil would be ‘very exciting’
text:
Jose Mourinho has an interest in the Brazil national team (Picture: Getty) Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho has admitted that he finds the prospect of managing Brazil one day ‘very exciting’.
Wenger fires warning to Chelsea over Sanchez pursuit Mourinho signed a three-year contract at Old Trafford last May and the 54-year-old has already won the EFL Cup and the Community Shield in his one season with the Red Devils.
United have been heavily linked with a £173million move for Neymar in recent weeks but the Portuguese played down the side’s chances of landing the Barcelona superstar at the end of the campaign.
However, it appears Mourinho is keen on managing Neymar at international level when his time in England comes to an end.
Brazil became the first team to qualify for next year’s World Cup (Picture: Getty) ‘Coaching the Selecao would be very exciting,’ the former Chelsea boss revealed to ESPN Brasil ahead of United’s clash with West Brom.
‘But this job is for a Brazilian coach. Tite’s doing great.’
More: Football Arsene Wenger backtracks and throws his Arsenal future into further doubt 
Wenger reveals if Sanchez will start vs City after star sent message about a 'kick' 
Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Tite took over from Dunga last summer and the 55-year-old has already guaranteed Brazil qualification for the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
MORE: Deal: Ex-PSG star agrees to join Manchester United
